lines.text: El Cuelebere: The master thief returns, but do you bring treasure?
Beatriz: I have the artifact, easily acquired from the depths of Xibu lake.
El Cuelebere: You’re a useful little thief, it’s a shame I’m hungry.
*The artifact La Xana gave you begins to glow, enthralling Cuelebere*
El Cuelebere: Or perhaps dinner can wait, no need to rush wasting such a skilled thief.
Beatriz: You know what’s an even bigger waste?
That the great Cuelebre is wasting his time living in a small insignificant cave, scaring a bunch of pesky little villagers not worthy of his presence.
You need a cave worthy of the most magnificent dragon that ever lived and with this wealth you could even become the king of all dragons.
You make a good point, little thief. I should find bigger prey worthy of Cuelebre, these villagers have nothing more of value to offer anyway.
Beatriz: I would need the help of the Trasgu to accomplish this...
